div.p: I received a letter from Docr Hogg dated 21st of March last by which I learnt that you had handed him a letter directed to me, it has not come to hand; also one dated 3d February last in which he writes me that he Sec. the cospy of your letter that you wrote that there appeared to be a balance of Two hundred and Seventy Six Dollars due from me to the Government It is impossibly Sir that I can be indebted that Sum, or any Sum to the Government and on what acct I stand charged to that amt, I am at a loss to tell, the vouchers of acct forwarded by me must certainly never have reached there, or they have not been placed to my credit.
You would confer an oblidging favour to write me on what acct I stand charged; also inclose; a Schedule of the acct in order that I
may forward the vouchers if in my possession, if not that I may endevour to procure them.

It is not my wish that I should stand charged when I know that I am not in justce due the Government any thing; but to the contrary, if Such accts for Services as Qr MAster as forwarded by me are ever paid, the govt, is due me that amt

It is strange that this should be the first that I should hear of an acct with the Govt when other officers of the Army had a certain length of time for settling their accts, and were continued in Service for a certain period, for that express purpose be pleased on the Ret of this to write me on the Subject. With Respect Sir

Ntsthe date of the letters Red from Docr Hogg is set down incorrect, the one of the 21st March is the one in which he advises me of an acct withe Govt and that of 3d Feby contains the informaiton Sd to be in that of 21st March. D.B.
